alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 1:33PM PST until December 28 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches, except 5 to 20 inches above 7500 feet possible. Wind gusts near 50 mph possible with gusts up to 90 mph along the Sierra ridgetops. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy rain will move into the area Monday night. Snow will be possible above 7500-8500 feet overnight with initial accumulations of 6 to 11 inches through Tuesday morning above 9000 feet. Impacts will be limited to these higher elevations during this time.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time.
